html:
Professional Practice & Project Management

This module provides an opportunity for students to take part in a collaborative project during which you will be expected to work professionally and develop your professional practice. You will learn to use project management tools and techniques as well as developing other transferable skills. You will also gain an appreciation of legislation and standards applicable to ICT projects. The module also takes an extensive focus on careers and career pathway planning.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Elicit detailed requirements from a presented scenario and apply relevant tools, techniques and methods to design a solution to the problem. [Analysis, Application, Problem solving]

+  Plan and document the management of an ict project based on a given scenario estimating the timescales and allocating tasks with regard to risk, human and technical factors. [Application, Communication, Enquiry]

+  Understand and overcome the challenges of working in a team under pressure to deliver a fully documented solution, and relate these to an intended career pathway. [Knowledge and understanding, Communication]

+  Reflect critically on the degree of success of the project with reference to the application of tools and techniques, and adherence to relevant benchmarks, standards, ethics, legislation and other professional practice in the context of a career path. [Knowledge and understanding, Learning, Reflection]

Module Content:
